problem_names:
lemma no_better_in_s:
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<nexists>y. y \<in> S \<and> (f y) > (f x)"

lemma argmax_sol_in_s:
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "x \<in> S"

lemma leq_all_in_sol:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: preorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> S. f y \<ge> f x \<longrightarrow> y \<in> arg_max_set f S"

lemma all_leq:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: linorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> S. f x \<ge> f y"

lemma all_in_argmax_equal:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: linorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> arg_max_set f S. f x = f y"
translations:
lemma no_better_in_s:
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<nexists>y. y \<in> S \<and> (f y) > (f x)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<nexists>y. y \<in> S \<and> f x < f y

lemma argmax_sol_in_s:
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "x \<in> S"

lemma leq_all_in_sol:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: preorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> S. f y \<ge> f x \<longrightarrow> y \<in> arg_max_set f S"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>y\<in>S.
       f x \<le> f y \<longrightarrow> y \<in> arg_max_set f S

proof (prove)
using this:
  x \<in> arg_max_set f S
  \<lbrakk>?x \<le> ?y; ?y < ?z\<rbrakk> \<Longrightarrow> ?x < ?z

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>y\<in>S.
       f x \<le> f y \<longrightarrow> y \<in> arg_max_set f S

lemma all_leq:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: linorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> S. f x \<ge> f y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>y\<in>S. f y \<le> f x

lemma all_in_argmax_equal:
  fixes f :: "'a \<Rightarrow> ('b :: linorder)"
  assumes "x \<in> arg_max_set f S"
  shows "\<forall>y \<in> arg_max_set f S. f x = f y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>y\<in>arg_max_set f S. f x = f y
by (meson all_leq argmax_sol_in_s assms le_less no_better_in_s)
